intro: Kobresia littledalei, commonly known as the Littledale's sedge, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with triangular stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or semi-arid environments. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the sedge family. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species, with limited distribution across its native range.
